entry.title: Customizing Your PDF with the Categories of Class A Invoices
entry.content:
Hello!  

In this blog, we will walk you through the steps of designing the new PDF templates using Adobe LiveCycle to remain compliant with R.G. N° 5762/2025 and R.G. N°5764/2025 for Argentina. For more information, see Changes: New Class A invoice categories and withholding regime on the Regulatory Change Manager.

If you carry out sales, work placements or provision of services in Argentina using print character M for VAT-registered taxpayers, according to resolution R.G. N° 5762/2025 and R.G. N°5764/2025, as of December 1, 2025, you must replace the existing class M invoices with the new categories of Class A invoices: 

Categories of Class A Invoices 

Description 

What you need to do 

Standard Class A 

For taxpayers meeting all fiscal and solvency requirements 

Nothing 

Class A with legend “OPERACIÓN SUJETA A RETENCIÓN” 

For taxpayers who do not meet certain requirements 

You design a new PDF template 

Class A with legend “PAGO EN CBU INFORMADA” 

For taxpayers who may not meet solvency criteria, requiring payments to be made to a specific, declared bank account (CBU) 

You design a new PDF template 

Prerequisites: 

  • You have Adobe LiveCycle Designer on your computer and know how to design forms with this tool.  
  • You have assigned the Extensibility (SAP_CORE_BC_EXT) authorization role for your user.  

Procedure: 

1. Access the Maintain Form Templates (F1434) app.  

2. Go to the Predelivered Templates tab and search for the following PDF form:  

Document Type: 

Print Char A, B, E 

Form Template Name: 

EDO_AR_PRINT 

Data Source: 

EDOC_AR_PRINT_SRV_03 

3. Open the form template and select Download.  

4. Extract the downloaded ZIP file and open the .xdp file in the Adobe Livecycle Desginer.  

5. In the Adobe LifeCycle Designer, choose the Master Pages tab.   

6. From the Object Library, drag and drop a Text onto the PageType box of your PDF. (Note: We suggest placing the Text on the bottom left corner of the PageType box.)  

7. On the Hierarchy tab, select the new field (default name Text1) and open the context menu (right-click or press Shift+F10). Choose Rename, type Legenda, and press Enter.  

8. Edit the new Legenda text. Insert the respective text value: “PAGO EN CBU INFORMADA” or “OPERACIÓN SUJETA A RETENCIÓN”. 

9. On the Hierarchy tab, select the content field. 

10. After selecting the content field, open the Script Editor (default shortcut Ctrl+Shift+F5) and insert the following Javascript logic to configure Legenda field:  

if (this.resolveNode("sfHeader.content.var_PrintChar").rawValue == 'A' ) { 
  this.resolveNode("sfHeader.content.Legenda").presence = "visible"; 
} else { 
this.resolveNode("sfHeader.content.Legenda").presence = "hidden"; 
}

11. Save and name your template. 

12. Access the Maintain Form Templates (F1434) app. 

13. On the Custom Templates tab, choose New. Create a custom template for your form by making the following settings:  

  • Form Template Name: Enter a name for your form template.  
  • Language: Select the language of your form template.  
  • Select Form Template File: Upload the file that you've created in Adobe LiveCycle Designer.  
  • Data Source: EDOC_AR_PRINT_SRV_03  
  • Form Type: Choose Standalone.  

14. Save your form template.  

15. In your configuration environment, use the search function to open the Configure Printing Form for eInvoice (103277) configuration activity and assign your custom form template to the relevant eDocument type and branch.   

And that's it!

You can now open the eDocument Cockpit and submit your document. The PDF form templates you created contain the new categories of Class A invoices for VAT-registered taxpayers. 

Was this post helpful? Leave a like (kudo) and share the content with your colleagues. Feel free to leave feedback, comments, or questions in the space below.    

For more information, go to Document and Reporting Compliance for Argentina on the SAP Help Portal and make sure to follow SAP Document and Reporting Compliance.    

 

Regards, 

João Pedro Braun Agnes & Pedro Brum

entry.title: Learn more about Fiscalization 2.0 in Croatia: e-invoicing (B2B) , fiscalization and e-reporting
entry.content:
Regulatory Changes  
As part of the "Fiscalization 2.0" project and starting January 2026, the Croatian government is introducing B2B e-invoicing, e-reporting and fiscalization requirements. 

  • B2B/B2G e-invoicing: all businesses with VAT registration in Croatia need to send electronic invoices in the required format through an approved service provider.
  • Fiscalization: 
    • B2B/B2G invoices: issuer and receiver of e-invoices need to send the fiscal data of the invoice to authorities (digitally signed XML). 
    • B2C invoices: issuer of the e-invoice needs to send fiscal to authorities irrespective of payment method (currently required only for cash payments). 
  • E-reporting: in addition to invoicing data (fiscalization), the following reporting requirements need to be fulfilled: 
    • List of collected invoices (payment received), during reporting period (month) for invoice issuer. 
    • List of outbound deliveries for which e-invoice could not be delivered, during reporting period (month) for invoice issuer. 
    • List of rejected invoices, during reporting period (month) for invoice recipient. 

Planned SAP Solution 
SAP plans to support businesses in meeting these new requirements leveraging SAP Document and Reporting Compliance. This cloud-based solution offers end-to-end compliance for more than 55 countries, natively embedded into the ERP, without the need for data replication and reconciliation. 
To find our more and see in action how regulatory requirements in Croatia will be supported, mark your calendar on October 16, 2025, at 3:30pm CET and join our webinar covering the new Fiscalization, B2B e-Invoicing, and e-Reporting requirements in Croatia.  Register today and you'll:  

  • Gain insight on upcoming regulatory mandates 
  • Understand how SAP Document and Reporting Compliance supports these changes 
  • Learn how to prepare your system with necessary implementation and configuration  

Share with your peers, the webinar is free and can also be watched on demand afterwards.  

SAP Delivery Status  
Please monitor the Regulatory Change Manager application (further links below) to stay updated about the planned scope, delivery timeline and solution details: 

  •  B2B e-invoicing for domestic customer invoice and supplier invoice, last mile provider required: link  
  •  Send Fiscalization data to tax authorities: link 
  •  e-reporting presenting list of collected invoices during reporting period (month) for invoice issuer: link 

More information 

  • Official publication of the Fiscalization Act in the official Gazette (in Croatian) 
  • Legal changes published by Tax Authority (in Croatian):
    • https://planoporavka.gov.hr/UserDocsImages/dokumenti/Plan%20oporavka%20i%20otpornosti,%20srpanj%202021..pdf?vel=13435491 
    • https://porezna.gov.hr/fiskalizacija/bezgotovinski-racuni/fiskalizacija-bezgotovinskih-racuna
  • Customer & Partner Facing Workzones for Croatia link I Q&A  
  • Regulatory Change Manager for all countries and topics    
  • SAP Roadmap for Document and Reporting Compliance (DRC)  
  • Other Regional Collaboration Workzones - Request access by clicking on the topic/region of interest 
  • SAP Document and Reporting Compliance Community  
  • SAP Help for DRC link 
  • You Tube Video Channel on SAP DRC

entry.title: Setup communication for electronic submission of statutory reports.
entry.content:
In this blog post, I would like to provide a step-by-step guide to help you configure and integrate SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition or SAP S/4HANA Private Edition, specifically for electronic submission of statutory reports.

The communication and integration of SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition is available for a number of supported compliance reports per country / region (in both S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition or On-Premise). Through the list(s) above, all already delivered supported compliance tasks which relates to Submitting Statutory Reports Using SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, Cloud Edition as supported submission types are relevant for communication setup and application configuration. 

This blog post will provide you with a walkthrough to help you navigate through the different configuration aspects within the SAP Help portal.  With simple setup steps and the configuration of your environment you will achieve proper communication of your business system with SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition and authentication to the tax authorities. 

The value of the integration between SAP S/4HANA business systems and SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition lies in the fact the setup of the various steps shown below need to be done only once for communication purpose – once done the main communication is then available for all reports.

Then, once you have completed specific application configuration for your reporting entity and communication settings specific for your report, a single click submits the report from your business system (through the application Run Statutory Reporting) and triggers the entire flow to electronic submit to the tax authority.

The configuration/set up required for each compliance report is depicted below:

Configuration on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition business system:

  • Scope Item Activation (78L): Before starting, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition must have the communication scenario SAP_COM_0854 available for configuration of the communication in your business system.  If your report is listed on the S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition supported compliance tasks with supported submission type as  Submitting Statutory Reports Using SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, Cloud Edition, please request activation of the scope item 78L (more information in the SAP Note 3387894).
  • Onboarding to the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition: If you have entitlement through your license then the next step is the Initial Setup of SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition.
  • Connecting the Cloud Edition and the Business System: After onboarding, you must setup the Integration of SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition with your S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition business system.
    • Communication Setup details, with all the information required, are available at:
      • setup instruction of the scope item 78L or 
      • Integrating All Other Processes and Countries/Regions with SAP S/4HANA Cloud 
  • Reporting Configuration in the Business System and Cloud Edition: The final step is the specific configuration for your report.  Here you need to complete the following two main configurations: 
    • Configure your process-specific setting and authentication method for your reports per country/region in the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition (SAP BTP). Please verify it per your specific report at Process-Specific Setting.
    • Configure each statutory report by following the steps in the individual configuration documentation. This can be found by navigating to the links in the Reports column in the Reports Enabled for Electronic Submission..

Configuration on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition business systems:

  • Implementing Required SAP Notes: Before starting, the SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud Edition or On-Premise must contain the required implementation objects.  Each report includes these note details in the Supported Compliance Tasks by Country/Region table. To find this information, search by Country/Region and Task and the specific Submission Implementation Overview SAP Note. For example, if you search for United Kingdom and the task VAT Return, the Submission Implementation Overview SAP Note 3386362 appears in the Technical Information column.
  • Onboarding to the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition: If you have entitlement through your license then the next step is the Initial Setup of SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition.
  • Connecting the Cloud Edition and the Business System: After onboarding, you must setup the Integration of SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition with your S/4HANA business system.
    • Communication Setup details, with all the information required for the backend setup, are available at: Integrating All Other Processes and Countries/Regions with SAP S/4HANA 
  • Reporting Configuration in the Business System and Cloud Edition: The final step is the specific configuration for your report.  Here you need to complete the following two main configurations: 
    • Configure your process-specific setting and authentication method for your reports per country/region in the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition (SAP BTP). Please verify it per your specific report at Process-Specific Setting.
    • Configure each statutory report by following the steps in the individual configuration documentation. You can find the configuration documentation in SAP S/4HANA by navigating to the links in the Reports column in the Reports Enabled for Electronic Submission.

I hope this guide can provide a comprehensive understanding of the configuration steps and where to find all relevant information for the configuration of the communication setup in SAP S/4HANA Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition and SAP S/4HANA Cloud business systems.

Thank you and see you next time.

entry.title: Be electronic invoicing compliant in Angola with SAP Document Reporting Compliance
entry.content:
Angola Tax Authorities (Administracao Geral Tributaria) have published the technical specifications for their upcoming eInvoicing requirement, through the release of the Royal Decree (Decreto Executivo) n 683/25 published on 22nd of August 2025, which outlines the software data structure, electronic invoicing model, and technical and procedural specifications.

According to the Angola regulatory framework, taxpayers will need to use a certified electronic invoice software to generate and submit the electronic invoices to the Angola Tax Authority (AGT) in real time. The authenticity and integrity of electronically issued documents are ensured through a digital code defined by the AGT.

Angola Tax authorities will provide access to taxpayers and software producers to an eInvoicing portal (Portal do Parceiro), where specific authorizations will be granted to the parties; a testing phase will be provided. Whilst there was little indication that the deadline for large taxpayers would be delayed further to the 1st of October 2025, finally on 23rd of September, Angola Tax authorities announced a transitional period to adopt the mandate, lasting until the 1st of January 2026. Angola Tax authorities have also announced that the eInvocing portal will be made available to taxpayers by October 6th, 2025. From September 21st 2026, the obligation will be extended to all taxpayers.

As it is the case for the SAF-T mandate in Angola since 2020, the Tax authorities will require that the e-Invoicing software is certified with the Angola Tax authorities and allow for real-time transmission of information to the AGT; the certification will include the validation of the JSON for Invoices (Fatura), Credit Notes (Notas de Crédito), Receipts (Recibos) and Invoice-Receipts (Faturas-Recibo). The authenticity, integrity, and non-repudiation of electronically issued documents are ensured through a digital code defined by the AGT.

Taxpayers will need to enrol for E-invoicing through the AGT portal (Portal do Contribuinte) from where the certificates (Chave Publica e Chave Privada) will be available for download.

eInvoices will also need to have the specific series which needed to be communicated to AGT. Once the eInvoice is sent to AGT, AGT sends back a notification that the invoice was received and subsequently a message that the invoice is valid or invalid and, in case of the latter, the related reason. Once eInvoice is approved, taxpayer can send it to the recipient. AGT does not send the eInvoice to final recipient. eInvoices need to be capable of being printed in PDF including a QR code via the eInvocing software which will enable to check the invoice details.

Below picture depicts the Angola eInvoicing model:

Angola Tax authorities technical specifications for eInvoicing provide 7 different API REST services for integration with SIGT (Integrated Tax management system) and eInvocing softwares:

registerInvoice (registarFactura),

getStatus (obterEstado),

listInvoices (listarFacturas),

consultInvoice (consultarFactura),

requestSeries (solicitarSerie),

listSeries (listarSeries),

validateDocument (validarDocumento).   

Crimson Technology Partners has developed the SAP Document Reporting Compliance solution to respond to the eInvoicing mandate of Angola tax authorities. The solution is meeting the requirements of the Angola Tax authorities, and is ready to connect to the AGT platform, as soon as it is released.

SAP Document Reporting Compliance solutions by Crimson Technology partners respect the principle of consistent user experience across countries and uniform functionality across countries, without introducing any custom program or transaction code.

Our standard SAP Document Reporting Compliance Solution, provides a full staging area for testing, training and handbooks for your organisation, providing the following benefits:

  • Single Global Process using Document Reporting Compliance
  • E2E compliant solution built with the Angola Tax authorities
  • Generation of electronic invoices in XML format (FI, SD) for B2B and B2G
  • Self-billing scenario's
  • FICA and RE-FX billing
  • Manual or automated invoice submission
  • Receiving of e-invoices in XML format and Integration to VIM Software
  • Human Readable PDF in Cockpit for incoming invoices

The following image shows the high-level architecture of SAP Document Reporting Compliance Solution for Angola eInvoicing:

The following image shows the ERP detail of the outbound and inbound eInvocing process of SAP Document Reporting Compliance Solution for Angola:

The following image shows the ERP detail of the outbound eInvocing process of SAP Document Reporting Compliance Solution for Angola:

The following image shows the ERP detail of the inbound eInvocing process of SAP Document Reporting Compliance Solution for Angola:

In terms of implementation time, below is an estimate of project timeline with high-level phases:

Compatible with ECC, S/4HANA & S/4 Cloud, this is another step on the journey of global electronic invoicing across borders, in particular, for Africa where Nigeria just introduced a Peppol aligned eInvoicing system, and Morocco will introduce a pre-clearance model by 2026, following on Ghana, Kenya, and Ivory Coast.

Look out next for our Ivory Coast and Morocco solution!

entry.title: Comunidade SAP Belo Horizonte – Acompanhe nossas novidades e fique por dentro dos próximos eventos!
entry.content:
Comunidade SAP Belo Horizonte – Acompanhe nossas novidades e fique por dentro dos próximos eventos!

Olá, SAP Community! 👋

Meu nome é Neylon Silva Soares, sou consultor SAP com foco em Cloud Integration (CPI) e atualmente trabalho em projetos internacionais na Europa, em uma das maiores empresas farmacêuticas do continente, referência em boas práticas com SAP Integration Suite.

Com mais de 12 anos de experiência em desenvolvimento e arquitetura SAP (ABAP, BTP, Integration Suite, entre outros), venho dedicando os últimos anos à especialização em SAP Cloud Integration, atuando em projetos globais em empresas como Natura, LVMH, Chesapeake Energy (EUA), Hyve (UK), entre outras.

Sou também líder da Comunidade SAP de Belo Horizonte, onde tenho o prazer de contribuir com a organização de eventos como o SAP Inside Track BH, além de apoiar a produção de conteúdo técnico para nossa comunidade local e global.

entry.title: Configuration and Submission of your UK VAT Return
entry.content:
In this blog post, I would like to guide you on how to configure and integrate SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition with your business system to electronically submit the VAT return to the tax authorities in the United Kingdom.

One of the values of integrating your business systems with the cloud edition is the fact that the integration between systems needs to be done only once – after you are done, the systems are integrated and available for all of your reports.

This means that once you have completed the configuration specific for your reporting entity and made the communication settings specific for your tax authority, a single click in the Run Statutory Reports app submits the report from your business system and triggers the entire flow to electronically submit the VAT return report to HMRC, the tax authority.

For detailed information on how to integrate your business system with the cloud edition, you can access the Setup communication for electronic submission of s... - SAP Community blog post.

When doing the process-specific configuration, you are required to enter your HMRC credentials in the Manage Communication Settings app. If you're VAT-registered, HMRC automatically signs up new businesses for MTD for VAT, unless you're exempt or have applied for exemption. In both cases, consider the following:

  • Use compatible software: You must keep your digital VAT records and submit VAT returns using MTD-compatible software. SAP S/4HANA products provide the end-to-end process of recording your financial transactions, generating the VAT return, and submitting the report electronically using the mandated API from HMRC in the correct JSON file format.
  • Sign in with your Government Gateway ID: This is your credential for accessing HMRC services. If you don’t have one, you can create a Government Gateway account. For more information, see Create a Government Gateway account.
  • Link your software to HMRC: Authorize your system to communicate with HMRC using your Government Gateway credentials. For more information, see Granting Permission to Submit the VAT Return Report Electronically.

When performing the steps in the Manage Communication Settings app of the cloud edition, you enter your credentials for the UK MTD, that is, your VAT registration number. For more information, see Managing Communication Settings.

In your first submission, you will be prompted to enter your credentials in the HMRC portal. You will see a message asking if SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition, is authorized to access the HMRC portal. Please select "Yes".

For 18 months after the initial authorization, you will not need to enter a username and password for submissions again. The VAT return report is submitted as soon as you select the Submit option in the Run Statutory Reports app. However, the authorization needs to be renewed every 18 months. 

If, within those 18 months, the authorization grants are not valid at the time of submission for any reason, you will be redirected to HMRC to renew the access tokens before submission can take place.

 

END-TO-END PROCESS

Once you have integrated both systems and made the process-specific configuration, you can generate and submit the VAT return report to HMRC, as follows:

1 – Access the Run Statutory Reports app and enter the following parameters:

  • Reporting Entity
  • Report Name: GB_VAT_DCL
  • Reporting Year

2 - Choose Go.

 

3 - After running and completing the activities listed, for example, Manage Tax Items, select the Prepare VAT Return Statement (Great Britain) activity.

 

4 - Select New Run, check the default selection criteria, and make changes if required.

 

5 - After executing the report and checking the VAT return statement, choose Submit.

 

TROUBLESHOOTING

[1] If you are moving from SAP Document and Reporting Compliance service to SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition, you can find more information in  Moving to SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, Cloud Edition.

Be aware that you have to apply all referred SAP Notes and prerequisites of SAP Note 3386362 - UK VAT Return Submission: Implementation Overview.

For more information, you can also access the Frequently Asked Questions section of the Moving to SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, Cloud Edition. See Frequently Asked Questions.

 

[2] To enforce a new redirection:

1. Access the Manage Communication Settings - External Parties app in SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition.

2. Search by your Identification number and choose the respective entry.

3.  Choose the “X” (Delete Key) from the Authentication Setting section. A pop-up window appears, and you confirm your action.

 

 

 4. The authentication setting status is updated to “Incomplete”.

 

 5. Choose + (“Add Authentication Setting”) and, in the pop-up window, choose Authorization Code Flow as the authentication setting.

 

 

 6. The authentication setting status is updated to “Complete”.

 

Wait a few minutes before submitting your report to allow any cached items to be erased.

7. You can now resubmit your report using the Run Statutory Reports app. 

[3] Testing with HMRC is not supported

The tax authority in the United Kingdom (HMRC) doesn't provide a test environment in which you can test the submission process. You can, however, with a test subscription of SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition, test the connection between the cloud edition with your business system.  

Once you have configured the integration in the test environment, you can simulate the submission of UK-MTD from a reporting entity in the Run Statutory Reports. This proves the environment is configured properly.

 * Please note there is no communication with HMRC in this type of test.

* The Submit request will display an error message and log in the report informing the configuration is completed and ready for productive use.

Hopefully, this blog post gave you a detailed walkthrough of the steps needed to set up and configure the automatic electronic submission of the VAT Return. With this one-time setup, you can benefit from a seamless integration between your business system and SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition.

The integration with the cloud edition is available for a number of supported compliance reports per country/region. To know the reports supported with each business system, access the Supported Compliance Tasks and use the search and filter options to find the reports you want to submit and the business system you have.

entry.title: Recap: SAP Document and Reporting Compliance Virtual Summit 2025 – Insights and Impact
entry.content:
It began with a simple question in the chat: “Where are you joining from?” Within moments, responses lit up the screen — Bangalore, Tokyo, Singapore. Then came São Leopoldo, Paris, Buenos Aires, and Berlin. The SAP Document and Reporting Compliance Virtual Summit 2025 was underway, and it was clear: this isn’t just an annual virtual event — it is truly a global dialogue.

From the first keynote to the final Q&A, the summit reflected the shared challenges and ambitions of compliance professionals across continents. Whether navigating new tax mandates or exploring AI-powered reporting, this community of SAP customers, partners and SAP experts came together on September 25 to learn, connect, and shape the future of digital compliance.

With 4,400 registrants and over 1,350 participants dialing-in from nearly every continent, this year’s summit reaffirmed its role as a global platform for collaboration, innovation, and learning.

From Strategy to Execution: Empowering Global Compliance

The event opened with a keynote by Sergey Shvedov, SVP and Chief Product Officer of SAP Globalization, who outlined SAP’s strategy on end-to-end compliance worldwide. He emphasized SAP’s four-pillar strategy: Global coverage, continuous legal updates, extensibility, and audit-ready processes to help customers navigate evolving regulatory landscapes.

Customer Voices: Real-World Journeys and Lessons

This year’s summit spotlighted customer stories that brought SAP Document and Reporting Compliance to life:

  • Jubin Sharma from Nestlé shared their journey implementing SAP Document and Reporting Compliance to streamline tax and reporting processes across multiple regions.
  • Pedro Castro from SumUp demonstrated how SAP Document and Reporting Compliance accelerated invoice processing and payment cycles, improving operational agility.
  • Crimson Partners, joined by their customer Roche, delivered a joint session that showcased how partner-driven expertise can help customers scale compliance globally with one process and one solution. While Roche leverages Crimson’s support in specific countries, the session highlighted how collaborative planning and technical alignment — enabled by SAP Document and Reporting Compliance — can streamline implementation and daily operations across diverse jurisdictions.

These sessions underscored how SAP Document and Reporting Compliance is not just a compliance tool, but a strategic enabler for transforming compliance operations.

Innovation in Action and Practical Guidance

The event also brought SAP experts to address the latest roadmap updates and product enhancements. Topics ranged from smarter e-invoicing and AI-driven reporting to localization of cash flow statements and extensibility frameworks for universal coverage.

The summit concluded with a practical overview session offering configuration tips and implementation best practices — making the full set of recordings a valuable resource for both strategic and hands-on guidance.

Access the Information Package

All session recordings and slides are now available in the Information Package. Whether you attended live or are catching up, we invite you to explore the materials and continue the conversation.

Thank you to all the attendees, speakers, customers and partners who contributed to making this event a resounding success. Your participation and engagement are the driving force of this community.

While the summit is wrapped up, the journey towards mastering compliance is ongoing. Stay tuned for upcoming events, webinars, and resources from SAP that will continue to support your compliance journey.

We look forward to welcoming you to our next events as we continue to unlock the future of compliance together.

Learn more about SAP’s localized solutions at sap.com/localization and join our Localization community.

entry.title: New Enablement Video: Türkiye e-Ledger (e-Defter) Reporting in SAP Document and Reporting Compliance
entry.content:
We’re excited to share our latest enablement video on Türkiye’s e-Ledger (e-Defter) reporting using SAP Document and Reporting Compliance in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

The video provides a brief overview of the legal framework (Vergi Usul Kanunu), key configuration prerequisites, and a full step-by-step demonstration — from accessing the Statutory Reporting app to preparing the submission for the Turkish Revenue Administration (Gelir İdaresi Başkanlığı – GİB).

🎥 Watch the video here: https://sapvideo.cfapps.eu10-004.hana.ondemand.com/?entry_id=1_wp5do2me 

For more details, visit the official SAP Help Portal – E-Ledger Report for Türkiye

Enjoy watching the video!

entry.title: SAP Document and Reporting Compliance Belgium: Electronic Invoice in Utilities using Extensibility
entry.content:
You want to enable your system to create electronic documents for invoices posted in Utilities using SAP Document and Reporting Compliance. In this blog, we’ll show you an example on how this can be achieved using extensibility.  

Before you begin ensure that you have implemented the SAP Notes listed in 2424886 - Electronic Document Processing for Belgium: Implementation Overview. You can also refer the SAP Help Portal for more information, see Electronic Document Processing.
Ensure you have also implemented the SAP Notes listed in 2736880 - eDocument EU PEPPOL: Overview note for IS-U.

Steps to Create Electronic Documents

  • Create eDocument Class
    1. Create 'ZCL_EDOCUMENT_BE_ISU' eDocument class by inheriting CL_EDOCUMENT_EU_ISU class.
    2. Add the CONSTRUCTOR method in the ZCL_EDOCUMENT_BE_ISU eDocument class to map the 'Z' eDocument IS-U class name to the field ms_edocument-edocument_class. 
    3. Redefine the method DETERMINE_PROCESS to assign the processes BEINV and BEINVIN.
    4. Use the table TFK003EDOC to configure eDocument type against the accounting document type.
    Example:

    Country/Region 

    Application Area 

    Document Type 

    eDocument Type 

    IN 

    Utility Company 

    FA 

    BE_INV 

     5. Add the class CL_EDOC_PROCESS as Friends of 'ZCL_EDOCUMENT_BE_ISU' eDocument class. 

    Sample Code for CONSTRUCTOR and DETERMINE_PROCESS method:  
    Constructor method signature: 

METHOD constructor.
 super->constructor( io_source_data                 = io_source_data
                      iv_edoc_guid                   = iv_edoc_guid
                      iv_land                        = iv_land
                      iv_update_task                 = iv_update_task
                      iv_generic_badi_filter_adaptor = iv_generic_badi_filter_adaptor
                      iv_simulate_for_email_option = iv_simulate_for_email_option ).

  ms_edocument-land                   = 'BE'.
  ms_edocument-edocument_class        = 'ZCL_EDOCUMENT_BE_ISU'.
ENDMETHOD.
METHOD determine_process.
    CASE ms_edocument-edoc_type.
      WHEN 'BE_INVIN'.
        ms_edocument-process = 'BEINVIN'.
        ms_edocument-process_version = '0001'.
      WHEN OTHERS.
        CASE ms_edocument-interface_type.
          WHEN 'AIF_PROXY' OR 'STANDARD'.
            ms_edocument-process = 'BEINV'.
*           reference process is 'EUINV'
            ms_edocument-process_version = '0001'.
          WHEN OTHERS.
            MESSAGE e162(edocument) INTO gv_error_txt.
            raise_edoc_exception( ).
        ENDCASE.
    ENDCASE.
ENDMETHOD.

 

  • Create Factory Class
    1. Create a 'Z' factory class to get the instance of eDocument IS-U class by inheriting CL_EDOC_FACTORY class and redefine its method CREATE_EDOC_INSTANCE. 
    Example: ZCL_EDOC_FACTORY_BE_ISU
    2. Configure this 'Z' eDocument factory class in the view EDOFACTORYV using the transaction SM30.

    Source Type  

    Factory Class  

    ISU_INVOIC  

    ‘Z’ factory class name (your factory class that you just created)  


    Sample Code:
METHOD create_edoc_instances.

    DATA: lv_land_iso      TYPE edoc_land,
          lv_error_txt     TYPE string,
          ls_source_header TYPE edoc_src_header,
          lo_edocument     TYPE REF TO zcl_edocument_be_isu.

    CLEAR: lv_land_iso,
           lv_error_txt,
           ls_source_header,
           lo_edocument,
           et_edocument_obj.

* Country
    ls_source_header = io_source->get_header( ).
    CALL FUNCTION 'COUNTRY_CODE_SAP_TO_ISO'
      EXPORTING
        sap_code  = ls_source_header-land
      IMPORTING
        iso_code  = lv_land_iso
      EXCEPTIONS
        not_found = 1
        OTHERS    = 2.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      MESSAGE e881(b1) WITH ls_source_header-land INTO lv_error_txt.
    ENDIF.
    IF lv_land_iso <> 'BE'.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    CREATE OBJECT lo_edocument 
      EXPORTING
        io_source_data = io_source
        iv_update_task = iv_update_task.

    APPEND lo_edocument TO et_edocument_obj.

  ENDMETHOD.

  • Mapping Class
    1. We have a generic mapping class CL_EDOC_MAP_UBL_ISU. If you need to enhance the mapping logic, you can use the EDOC_ADAPTOR BAdI's method SET_OUTPUT_DATA. For more details, refer to Enhancements for Electronic Documents.
    Alternatively, you can implement your own custom mapping class. 
    2. Configure your mapping class in the view EDOMAPCLASSDETV using the transaction SM30. 
    Example:

    eDocument Process 

    Version 

    Interface ID 

    eDocument Type 

    Source Type 

    Mapping Class 

    EUINV 

    1 

    UBL_INVOICE_TRANSM

    BE_INV 

    ISU_INVOIC 

    <Your Z mapping class or CL_EDOC_MAP_UBL_ISU> 

     

  • Maintain the Required Customizations
    Apart from maintaining Master Data, Customizing and Integration as explained in the SAP Help Portal, you must also configure the company code for the following IS-U source type.

    1.  Activate company code for ISU_INVOIC source type in the view EDOCOMPANYACTIV for eDocument creation.
    Example:

    Company Code  

    Source Type  

    Application Active  

    <Your company code>  

    ISU_INVOICE  

    X  


By following these steps, you can efficiently create electronic documents for invoices in the utilities sector, ensuring compliance and enhancing operational efficiency. 

Don't forget to test it thoroughly. 

We hope this blog post was useful for you! You can leave a comment here or continue browsing our community for more blog posts on SAP Document and Reporting Compliance topics. 

Looking forward to seeing you here again!

entry.title: Enhancing Your Understanding of Peru's Inventory and Balance Ledger Report: Updates to Documentation
entry.content:
I’m Maitê, a User Assistance Developer in SAP Globalization, working in the financial area. As part of my role, I’m happy to share with you the latest updates to the documentation for the Peru Inventory and Balance Ledger report in SAP Document and Reporting Compliance. Explore the highlights below to discover how these improvements can help with the report!

The Report

The Peru Inventory and Balance Ledger report is currently available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, and SAP S/4HANA. The report organizes general ledger balances into subledgers across fourteen electronic accounting books, following Peru's PCGE (Plan Contable General Empresarial) and SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de Administración Tributaria) requirements. 

Recent Documentation Improvements

To help you better understand the Inventory and Balance Ledger report, we have enhanced our documentation with a new page. This addition provides details on specific fields, grouped by configuration settings and characteristics. Our goal is to clarify the relationships between certain fields in the report output and the configurations made by you before running the report.

New page added to the SAP Help Portal

 

Structured Tables for Clarity

We've organized the documentation into five tables:

  • Table 1:  Fields Related to Financial Statement Version (FSV) and G/L Account Hierarchies

This table highlights fields associated with hierarchy configurations from the app Manage Global Hierarchies, focusing on Financial Statement Versions and G/L Account hierarchy types.

  • Table 2: Fields Related to Alternative Chart of Accounts (COA)

This table details fields related to the alternative COA settings used for specific legal reporting requirements in Peru.

  • Table 3: Fields Tax Number Type and Tax Number Related to Alternative Chart of Accounts (COA)

This table specifies details on tax-related fields which are associated with the alternative COA settings.

  • Table 4: Other Fields in the Report

This table provides information about other fields, explaining their data sources and how the system populates them.

  • Table 5: Optional Fields in the Report

Finally, this table lists optional fields included in our solution and explains how they are populated, though they are not required by SUNAT.

Conclusion

We really hope these documentation updates make your journey through the Inventory and Balance Ledger report easier and more efficient. You can find them in the report documentation linked below:

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition: Inventory and Balance Ledger 
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition and SAP S/4HANA: Inventory and Balance Ledger

Feel free to explore these tables on the SAP Help Portal and share your questions or feedback in the comments. They are most welcome!

Last but not least, follow the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance community tag for the latest updates. 

Thank you and until next time,

Maitê Bohn

entry.title: Mejorando tu Comprensión del Libro de Inventarios y Balances de Perú: Nueva Documentación
entry.content:
Soy Maitê, desarrolladora de asistencia al usuario en SAP Globalization, y trabajo en el área financiera. Como parte de mi rol, me complace compartir las últimas actualizaciones en la documentación del reporte Libro de Inventarios y Balances de Perú en SAP Document and Reporting Compliance. Explora los aspectos destacados a continuación para descubrir cómo estas mejoras pueden ayudarte con el reporte!

El reporte

El Libro de Inventarios y Balances de Perú está actualmente disponible en SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition y SAP S/4HANA. El reporte organiza los saldos de las cuentas de mayor en catorce libros, siguiendo los requerimientos del PCGE (Plan Contable General Empresarial) y de la SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de Administración Tributaria).

Mejoras recientes en la documentación

Para ayudarte a comprender mejor el reporte, hemos añadido una página nueva a la documentación. Esta nueva página proporciona detalles sobre campos específicos, agrupados según configuraciones y características. Nuestro objetivo es aclarar las relaciones entre ciertos campos del reporte y las configuraciones necesarias antes de ejecutarlo.
Nueva página agregada en SAP Help Portal

 

Tablas estructuradas para mayor claridad

Hemos organizado la documentación en cinco tablas:

  • Tabla 1: Campos relacionados con las jerarquías FSV y G/L Account

Esta tabla destaca los campos asociados con la configuración de jerarquías de la aplicación Manage Global Hierarchies y se enfoca en dos tipos de jerarquía: Financial Statement Versions (FSV) y G/L Account.

  • Tabla 2: Campos relacionados con el plan de cuentas alternativo

Detalla los campos relacionados con la configuración del plan de cuentas alternativo usado para requerimientos legales específicos en Perú.

  • Tabla 3: Campos Tax Number Type y Tax Number relacionados con el plan de cuentas alternativo

Ofrece detalles sobre campos relacionados con impuestos asociados a la configuración del plan de cuentas alternativo.

  • Tabla 4: Otros campos en el reporte

Proporciona información sobre otros campos, explicando sus fuentes de datos y cómo los completa el sistema.

  • Tabla 5: Campos opcionales en el reporte

Por último, esta tabla presenta los campos opcionales incluidos en nuestra solución y explica cómo los completa el sistema, aunque no son requeridos por la SUNAT.

Conclusión

Esperamos que estas actualizaciones en la documentación faciliten tu trabajo con el reporte Libro de Inventarios y Balances. Puedes encontrarlas en la documentación del reporte enlazada abajo:

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition: Inventory and Balance Ledger
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition y SAP S/4HANA: Inventory and Balance Ledger

Te invitamos a explorar estas tablas en el SAP Help Portal y a compartir cualquier pregunta o comentarios que tengas. ¡Serán bienvenidos!

Por último, pero no menos importante, sigue SAP Document and Reporting Compliance en la comunidad para recibir actualizaciones.

Gracias y hasta la próxima,

Maitê Bohn

entry.title: Como a Reforma Tributária no Brasil Impacta os usuários SAP
entry.content:
Click here for the english version.

A reforma tributária no Brasil é um tema de grande relevância para empresas que precisam se adaptar a estas mudanças legais. Para os usuários SAP, é importante entender como a reforma afeta os processos logísticos e financeiros, estar ciente dos prazos de implantação e saber quais são as soluções providas pela SAP para garantir uma transição tranquila.

Cronograma de Implementação da Reforma

  • 2026: A reforma tributária começa a ser testada, com taxas iniciais mais baixas de 0,9% para a Contribuição sobre Bens e Serviços (CBS) e 0,1% para o Imposto sobre Bens e Serviços (IBS).
  • 2027: A CBS passa a valer, substituindo PIS e Cofins. A alíquota de IPI será zerada, exceto para produtos industrializados na ZFM.
  • 2028: Último ano de ICMS e ISS sem alteração.
  • 2029: Eliminação gradual do ICMS e ISS, com redução anual de 10% em suas taxas, como parte da substituição pelo IBS.
  • 2033: Adoção integral do novo regime tributário, com a extinção de ICMS e ISS.

Entregas da SAP
A SAP está comprometida em apoiar seus clientes durante a transição para o novo modelo tributário. As soluções SAP estão sendo atualizadas para atender aos novos requisitos legais, garantindo que as empresas possam se adequar às mudanças.

SNOTE: Note Analyzer tool
Recomendamos fortemente o uso da ferramenta Note Analyzer para organizar a implementação das SAP Notes desta solução. Consulte a SAP Note 3200109 para obter instruções sobre essa ferramenta e utilize o arquivo XML anexo à SAP Note 3561376 para relacionar as entregas da SAP para a Reforma Tributária do Brasil. A versão mais recente do Note Analyzer introduz um recurso que exibe a ordem de implementação na coluna "comentários" após a importação do XML. Siga esta ordem, mesmo que algumas SAP Notes não sejam relevantes para o seu negócio. Observe que a ferramenta fornece a ordem correta, mas não uma lista completa dos pré-requisitos das SAP Notes. Assim, análises adicionais podem ser necessárias para lidar com possíveis dependências.

Observações importantes durante a implementação das SAP notes
Para cada nota SAP que será implementada, reserve um momento para ler o seu conteúdo em texto. Desta forma, será possível se informar sobre notas pré-requisito conhecidas, passos manuais a serem executados antes ou depois da implementação automática das instruções de correção, assim como ficar ciente de outras instruções. A leitura do conteúdo de cada nota a ser implementada pode evitar problemas de implementação e a necessidade de retrabalho.
Além disso, é muito importante não prosseguir para a implementação de SAP notes subsequentes deixando notas anteriores incorretamente implementadas no sistema (status incompletely implemented), pois isso leva a um sistema corrompido e sem os contextos e objetos necessários para futuras implementações. Portanto, ao implementar uma lista de SAP Notes, assegure-se de que cada nota está sendo implementada corretamente e completamente.

Recursos de Apoio
A SAP disponibiliza vários recursos de apoio, entre eles:

  • SAP Work Zone - Brazil - Tax Reform Localization: Permite que clientes e parceiros da SAP compartilhem informações e colaborem em assuntos relacionados à Reforma Tributária. Este espaço tem atualização diária.
  • Plataforma Regulatory Change Manager: Anúncios de mudanças legais e planejamento de entregas de soluções.
  • SAP Note 3561376 - Tax Reform Leading SAP Note para leitura: Descreve a estratégia de entrega e suporte para a solução de Reforma Tributária do Brasil. Esta nota, de atualização frequente, lista as entregas da solução conforme são liberadas para clientes. Assim, anexado a ela está o arquivo XML sempre atualizado para o uso no Note Analyzer, auxiliando a implementação das SAP Notes na ordem adequada.
  • SAP Note 3637842 - Brazil Tax Reform - Testing Limitations with SEFAZ para leitura: Esta SAP Note informativa destaca os processos ainda não suportados pela SAP relacionados à Reforma Tributária no Brasil, especialmente sobre cenários a serem testados com a SEFAZ. Esta nota será atualizada regularmente.
  • KBA 3642384 - Brazil Tax Reform Troubleshooting Guide: Além de explicar sobre a entrega da SAP e trazer os links diretos da plataforma Regulatory Change Manager para os assuntos da Reforma Tributária, este KBA de Troubleshooting auxilia a resolver os possíveis problemas já identificados durante a implementação das SAP notes. Ao oferecer soluções para problemas comuns, este KBA é continuamente atualizado para incluir novas informações.

SAP ERP - Help Portal

  • Grupos de impostos e tipos de imposto adicionados à nota fiscal
  • Impostos CBS e IBS como valores estatísticos na nota fiscal
  • Definir situação tributária para CBS e IBS
  • Situação tributária CBS e IBS para vendas
  • Modificações de montante base para CBS e IBS utilizando TAXBRA
  • Ativação de NBS para determinação CBS e IBS em cenários de compras
  • Modificações de montante base para CBS e IBS utilizando o esquema de cálculo TAXBRJ
  • Campos adicionados à nota fiscal para impostos CBS e IBS
  • Cálculo da taxa nominal e textos de nota fiscal para CBS e IBS no Nota Fiscal Writer
  • Modificações de montante base para CBS e IBS utilizando procedimentos de determinação de preços RVABRA e RVXBRA
  • Determinar situação tributária para Business Add In CBS e IBS
  • Campos adicionados para taxas nominais na estrutura de BAdI da nota fiscal
  • Campo adicionado à tabela de nota fiscal para cálculo de imposto IBS
  • Situação tributária CBS e IBS para compras
  • Determinação do imposto ampliada com situação tributária para CBS e IBS para processos de vendas
  • Campos adicionados às estruturas BAdI e BAPIs da nota fiscal
  • Situação tributária CBS e IBS para movimento de mercadorias

SAP S/4HANA - Help Portal

  • Grupos de impostos e tipos de imposto adicionados à nota fiscal
  • Impostos CBS e IBS como valores estatísticos na nota fiscal
  • Definir situação tributária para CBS e IBS
  • Situação tributária CBS e IBS para vendas
  • Modificações de montante base para CBS e IBS utilizando TAXBRA
  • Ativação de NBS para determinação CBS e IBS em cenários de compras
  • Modificações de montante base para CBS e IBS utilizando o esquema de cálculo TAXBRJ
  • Campos adicionados à nota fiscal para impostos CBS e IBS
  • Cálculo da taxa nominal e textos de nota fiscal para CBS e IBS no Nota Fiscal Writer
  • Modificações de montante base para CBS e IBS utilizando procedimentos de determinação de preços RVABRA e RVXBRA
  • Determinar situação tributária para Business Add In CBS e IBS
  • Campos adicionados para taxas nominais na estrutura de BAdI da nota fiscal
  • Campo adicionado à tabela de nota fiscal para cálculo de imposto IBS
  • Situação tributária CBS e IBS para compras
  • Determinação do imposto ampliada com situação tributária para CBS e IBS para processos de vendas
  • Campos adicionados às estruturas BAdI e BAPIs da nota fiscal
  • Situação tributária CBS e IBS para movimento de mercadorias

Prazo de Implementação para clientes
Os clientes SAP precisam ter as soluções SAP referentes à reforma tributária totalmente implementadas e testadas até dezembro de 2025, para garantir conformidade com as novas obrigações a partir de janeiro de 2026.

Validação por parte do governo
Atualmente, é possível testar a aprovação de documentos com os campos dos novos tributos em ambiente de homologação da SEFAZ e, de forma facultativa, enviá-los também em produção.
O ambiente produtivo da SEFAZ começará a validar os novos campos de XML da NF-e relacionados aos impostos da reforma tributária a partir de janeiro de 2026. Até essa data, o preenchimento desses novos campos é facultativo e, mesmo que preenchidos, não devem causar rejeição na aprovação da NF-e.
A partir de janeiro de 2026, o preenchimento dos campos dos novos impostos será obrigatório, com valor jurídico, para documentos fiscais eletrônicos em ambiente de produção. A não conformidade poderá levar à rejeição das notas fiscais.

Conclusão
A reforma tributária no Brasil traz uma mudança legal significativa, portanto, esteja atento ao prazo de adequação.
As notas informativas da SAP listadas acima e o KBA de troubleshooting seguirão em constante atualização para que você tenha acesso a informações relevantes enquanto atualiza o seu sistema.
Utilize os recursos disponíveis e interaja no Work Zone para tirar dúvidas.

entry.title: How the Tax Reform in Brazil Impacts SAP Users
entry.content:
Clique aqui para a versão em português.

Tax reform in Brazil is a topic of great relevance for companies that need to adapt to these legal changes. For SAP users, it is important to understand how the reform affects logistical and financial processes, be aware of implementation deadlines, and know what solutions SAP provides to ensure a smooth transition.

Implementation Timeline of the Tax Reform

  • 2026: The tax reform begins to be tested, with initial lower rates of 0.9% for the Contribution on Goods and Services (CBS) and 0.1% for the Tax on Goods and Services (IBS).
  • 2027: CBS comes into effect, replacing PIS and Cofins. The IPI rate will be zeroed, except for industrialized products in the ZFM.
  • 2028: Last year of ICMS and ISS without changes.
  • 2029: Gradual elimination of ICMS and ISS, with an annual reduction of 10% in their rates, as part of the replacement by IBS.
  • 2033: Full adoption of the new tax regime, with the extinction of ICMS and ISS.

SAP Deliverables
SAP is committed to supporting its clients during the transition to the new tax model. SAP solutions are being updated to meet the new legal requirements, ensuring that companies can adapt to the changes.

SNOTE: Note Analyzer tool
We strongly recommend using the Note Analyzer tool to organize the implementation of SAP Notes for this solution. Refer to SAP Note 3200109 for instructions on this tool and use the XML file attached to SAP Note 3561376 to list the SAP deliverables for Brazil's Tax Reform. The latest version of Note Analyzer introduces a feature that displays the implementation order in the "comments" column after importing the XML. Follow this order, even if some SAP Notes are not relevant to your business. Note that the tool provides the correct order but not a complete list of prerequisites for the SAP Notes. Therefore, additional analysis may be necessary to address potential dependencies.

Important observations during the implementation of SAP notes
For each SAP Note to be implemented, take a moment to read its textual content. This way, you can become informed about known prerequisite notes, manual steps to be executed before or after the automatic implementation of correction instructions, and be aware of other instructions. Reading the content of each note to be implemented can help avoid implementation issues and the need for rework.
Moreover, it is crucial not to proceed with the implementation of subsequent SAP Notes, leaving previous notes incorrectly implemented in the system (status: incompletely implemented), as this leads to a corrupted system and the absence of necessary contexts and objects for future implementations. Therefore, when implementing a list of SAP Notes, ensure that each note is implemented correctly and completely.

Support Resources
SAP provides several support resources, including:

  • SAP Work Zone - Brazil - Tax Reform Localization: It allows SAP customers and partners to share information and collaborate on matters related to the Tax Reform. This space is updated daily.
  • The Regulatory Change Manager tool: Announcements of legal changes and planning of solution deliverables.
  • SAP Note 3561376 - Tax Reform Leading SAP Note for reading: It describes the delivery and support strategy for the Brazil Tax Reform solution. This frequently updated SAP Note lists the solution deliverables as they are released to customers. Attached to it is an always-updated XML file to be used on the Note Analyzer, assisting you in the implementation of SAP Notes in the proper order.
  • SAP Note 3637842 - Brazil Tax Reform - Testing Limitations with SEFAZ for reading: This informational SAP Note highlights the processes not yet supported by SAP related to the Tax Reform in Brazil, especially regarding scenarios to be tested with SEFAZ. This note will be updated regularly.
  • KBA 3642384 - Brazil Tax Reform Troubleshooting Guide: In addition to explaining SAP's deliverables and providing direct links to the Regulatory Change Manager platform for Tax Reform topics, this Troubleshooting KBA helps resolve potential issues already identified during the implementation of SAP Notes. By offering solutions to common problems, this KBA is continuously updated to include new information.

SAP ERP - Help Portal

  • Tax Groups and Tax Types Added to Nota Fiscal
  • CBS and IBS Taxes as Statistical Values in Nota Fiscal
  • Define Tax Situation for CBS and IBS
  • CBS and IBS Tax Situation for Sales
  • Base Amount Changes for CBS and IBS Using TAXBRA
  • Enablement of NBS for CBS and IBS Determination in Purchasing Scenarios
  • Base Amount Changes for CBS and IBS Using TAXBRJ Pricing Procedure
  • Fields Added to Nota Fiscal for CBS and IBS Taxes
  • Nominal Rate Calculation and Nota Fiscal Texts for CBS and IBS in Nota Fiscal Writer
  • Base Amount Changes for CBS and IBS Using RVABRA and RVXBRA Pricing Procedures
  • Determine Tax Situation for CBS and IBS Business Add-In
  • Fields Added for Nominal Rates in Nota Fiscal BAdI Structure
  • Field Added to Nota Fiscal Table for IBS Tax Calculation
  • CBS and IBS Tax Situation for Purchasing
  • Enhanced Tax Determination with Tax Situation for CBS and IBS for Sales Processes
  • Fields Added to Nota Fiscal BAdI and BAPIs structures
  • CBS and IBS Tax Situation for Goods Movement

SAP S/4HANA - Help Portal

  • Tax Groups and Tax Types Added to Nota Fiscal
  • CBS and IBS Taxes as Statistical Values in Nota Fiscal
  • Define Tax Situation for CBS and IBS
  • CBS and IBS Tax Situation for Sales
  • Base Amount Changes for CBS and IBS Using TAXBRA
  • Enablement of NBS for CBS and IBS Determination in Purchasing Scenarios
  • Base Amount Changes for CBS and IBS Using TAXBRJ Pricing Procedure
  • Fields Added to Nota Fiscal for CBS and IBS Taxes
  • Nominal Rate Calculation and Nota Fiscal Texts for CBS and IBS in Nota Fiscal Writer
  • Base Amount Changes for CBS and IBS Using RVABRA and RVXBRA Pricing Procedures
  • Determine Tax Situation for CBS and IBS Business Add-In
  • Fields Added for Nominal Rates in Nota Fiscal BAdI Structure
  • Field Added to Nota Fiscal Table for IBS Tax Calculation
  • CBS and IBS Tax Situation for Purchasing
  • Enhanced Tax Determination with Tax Situation for CBS and IBS for Sales Processes
  • Fields Added to Nota Fiscal BAdI and BAPIs structures
  • CBS and IBS Tax Situation for Goods Movement

Implementation Deadline for Customers
SAP customers must have the SAP solutions related to the tax reform fully implemented and tested by December 2025 to ensure compliance with the new obligations starting from January 2026.

Government Validation
Currently, it is possible to test document approval with the fields for the new taxes in SEFAZ's homologation environment, and optionally, to send them in production as well. SEFAZ's production environment will begin validating the new XML fields of NF-e related to the tax reform taxes starting in January 2026. Until that date, filling out these new fields is optional and, even if filled, should not cause rejection in NF-e approval.
From January 2026, filling out the fields for the new taxes will be mandatory, with legal significance, for electronic tax documents in the production environment. Non-compliance may lead to the rejection of the invoices.

Conclusion
The tax reform in Brazil represents a significant legal change, so be mindful of the deadline for compliance.
The SAP informational notes listed above and the troubleshooting KBA will be continuously updated to ensure you have access to relevant information as you update your system.
Utilize the available resources and engage in the Work Zone to clarify any doubts.

entry.title: Electronic Invoices in Poland (KSeF 2.0) with SAP Document and Reporting Compliance
entry.content:
Starting in February or April 2026, depending on your revenue, all Polish invoices will be required to be exchanged through KSeF. Following the postponement of the mandate originally planned for 2024, the Ministry of Finance has released a new KSeF system, KSeF 2.0 with the following timelines:

  • February 1, 2026:
    • Submission of electronic invoices to KSeF is obligatory for companies whose sales value in the previous tax year exceeded PLN 200 million.
    • Receiving e-invoices from KSeF is obligatory for all.

  • April 1, 2026 - submission of electronic invoices to KSeF is obligatory for others.

SAP has therefore updated its global solution SAP Document and Reporting Compliance to enable electronic invoices through KSeF 2.0.  To explore the latest functionalities and gain insights to accelerate your implementation, even if you have already implemented KSeF 1.0, we invite you to join our SAP hosted complimentary webinar:

🗓️ Thursday, November 20, 2025

entry.title: Understanding the Belgium B2B e-Invoicing Mandate and the Plant Abroad Scenario
entry.content:
Introduction

From January 1, 2026, structured B2B e-invoicing will become mandatory in Belgium for transactions between businesses established in Belgium.
The requirement applies to all domestic B2B supplies of goods and services where both supplier and buyer are VAT-registered and established in Belgium.

SAP supports the Belgian B2B e-Invoicing mandate through SAP Document and Reporting Compliance (SAP DRC), which enables businesses to create and transmit Peppol BIS Billing 3.0 XML invoices in full compliance via the Peppol network.

For foundational details, refer to Peppol Participant Registration for Belgian Companies 

 

The “Plant Abroad” Challenge

Businesses operate through foreign legal entities that maintain fixed establishments in Belgium, often configured in SAP using the Plant Abroad functionality.

Scenario:

  • The head company code is registered in another EU country (e.g., The Netherlands).

  • The company has a Belgian VAT registration and Belgian local address maintained in table T001N.

Transactions are issued under the Belgian VAT number, making them legally in scope of the Belgium e-invoicing mandate.

However, the SAP DRC Belgium B2B e-invoicing solution currently supports only company codes established in Belgium out of the box. This means that for “plant abroad” configurations, extensibility via the SAP DRC standard BAdI .

Workaround: Using the EDOC_ADAPTOR BAdI

Key idea:
Adjust the outbound XML data and replace the seller’s details (VAT ID, GLN, and address) with the Belgian fixed establishment information before submission to Peppol.

Here are the steps:

Master Data Prerequisite

           Verify that in T001N table:

  •  The Belgian VAT number (e.g., BE012345678) is correctly maintained.       
  •  The address number points to the valid local Belgian establishment address (from ADRC).
    BAdI Implementation for EDOC_ADAPTOR--->SET_OUTPUT_DATA.
    1. Read Belgian VAT ID and address number from T001N table.
    2. Assign the following tags in the EDO_UBL_STANDARD_BUSINESS_DOC2  structure:
StandardBusinessDocument\StandardBusinessDocumentHeader\Sender\Identifier​

Sender Endpoint Assignment

StandardBusinessDocument\Invoice\AccountingSupplierParty\Party\EndpointID

          

StandardBusinessDocument\Invoice\AccountingSupplierParty\PartyTaxScheme\CompanyID

 

StandardBusinessDocument\Invoice\AccountingSupplierParty\PartyLegalEntity\CompanyID

 

StandardBusinessDocument\Invoice\AccountingSupplierParty\PostalAddress
StandardBusinessDocument\Invoice\AccountingSupplierParty\PostalAddress\StreetName
StandardBusinessDocument\Invoice\AccountingSupplierParty\PostalAddress\CityName
StandardBusinessDocument\Invoice\AccountingSupplierParty\PostalAddress\PostalZone
StandardBusinessDocument\Invoice\AccountingSupplierParty\PostalAddress\CountrySubentity
StandardBusinessDocument\Invoice\AccountingSupplierParty\PostalAddress\Country\IdentificationCode

 

 

 

Expected Outcome:
  • Successful e-Invoice Submission: 

    The generated XML will now contain the correct Belgian VAT ID and Belgian address information in the relevant Peppol BIS 3.0 fields. The invoice passes both SAP DRC validation and Peppol network checks.

  • Sender Identifier must reflect Belgian Information:

    The Belgian VAT ID or GLN is properly reflected in the Standard Business Document Header of the XML.

  • Correct Endpoint Identification for Peppol Transmission:

    The  <Endpoint> under <AccountingSupplierParty> ensures proper routing within the Peppol network using the Belgian VAT ID or GLN. Also, make sure that the tags <CompanyID> reflect correct Belgian VAT.

  • Accurate Representation of the Fixed Establishment:

    The seller’s postal address represents the Belgian fixed establishment instead of the foreign head office address.

entry.title: Fichier des Écritures Comptables (FEC)
entry.content:
In France we have a legal requirement to submit a file of accounting entries for the closed fiscal year in a dematerialized format (Article L47 A I ) which is effective from 01.01.2014.

Upon receiving request from the tax authorities, a company has 15 days to prepare and submit the FEC file. In case of failing to deliver the FEC file or in the event of non-compliance, companies could face significant penalties

This file consists of entries after inventory operations, excluding centralization entries and excluding entries for balancing expense and revenue accounts. It includes the entries for the recovery of balances from the previous fiscal year and contains, for each entry, all accounting data present in the company's computerized accounting system, with the first eighteen pieces of information required to correspond, in order, to those listed in the following table:

 

 

Further information about the legal requirements can be found here

Article L47 A - Book of Tax Procedures – Légifrance

Article A47 A-1 - Livre des procédures fiscales - Légifrance

How to generate the FEC file from SAP? 

DRC or DART

Document and Reporting Compliance (DRC)

It enables you to create, process, and monitor electronic documents and statutory reports. As a result, your company stays compliant with local legal obligations.

Statutory reporting has been localized for use by businesses with operations in the country/region and it comprises functions designed for laws and business practices relevant in the country/region.

You can generate the audit file for France using the Run Statutory Reports app. This file is referred to as "FEC - Fichier des Écritures Comptables".

Further information can be found here

Supported Compliance Tasks by Country/Region | SAP Help Portal

Audit File (FEC) | SAP Help Portal

Data Retention Tool (DART)

The Data Retention Tool (DART) helps SAP users to meet the legal requirements concerning data retention and data transfer for tax auditing. You can use DART to extract and store data that is relevant to tax from SAP applications at regular intervals. DART extracts the data into sequential files and provides tools that you can use to display and evaluate the stored data.

In general, two steps are required in DART to create machine-readable files for the tax auditor.

The first step in DART involves generating extract files that capture data based on the selected company code and areas like FI, CO, SD, and MM, with customizable restrictions.

In the second step, extract files are transformed into view files according to tax auditor specifications by defining which segments are included and how they are combined.

Further information can be found here

Introduction to the Data Retention Tool (DART) | SAP Help Portal

What are the technical prerequisites for FEC solution by DART?

The recommendation from SAP is to be on the highest version of DART with all the latest notes implemented.

you can check the DART version in the SE11.

You should choose there the "TYPE GROUP": DART1. Then click display

 

The most important technical prerequisites are included in this note

2162977 - DART: Order of implementation of notes for FEC - SAP for Me

Depending on release & support package of the relevant system, some of them should have been delivered by default.

Configuration for DART can be checked in SAP Help Portal

Configuration | SAP Help Portal

DART is often pre-configured for FEC by the installed SAP notes. You mainly need to Configure the Extract File Directories and set directory paths

What is the exact business process?

The prerequisite before running these processes is that your fiscal year is completely closed!

1st step Posting of opening balances France

2nd step Create DART extracts

3rd step Generation of the FEC

Posting of opening balances France

Run Program RFOPENPOSTING_FR with Tcode SE38 or Tcode FAGL_FR_03

This report creates opening entries for balance sheet accounts from the previous year in accordance with the French requirement to submit posting data to the French tax authorities.

Based on the account balances and open items on the key date, FI documents are posted and form the basis of the data extract. These postings represent the balance carryforward but do not generate balances.

For these postings, no subledger documents (customer/vendor/Asset Accounting) are written.

No open items are generated.

The report is available for classic General Ledger Accounting and new General Ledger Accounting.

The documents are specially indicated:

1) The document status is 'O' (balance sheet opening entry).

2) The reference transaction is 'GLYEC' (year-end closing document).

3) The documents are posted in period '0' of the carryforward year.

Documents are generated for each account, customer, and vendor. Information about the customer and vendor is stored in the LIFNR/KUNNR fields as well as in the assignment.

The balances of the respective balance sheet accounts are cleared against "Balance Sheet Account - Opening" on the selection screen.

The posted documents can be reversed with the FI reversal transactions (FB08/F.80).

Compare entries with G/L account Balance Tcode FAGLB03

New list RFOPENPOSTING_FR 

Account balance

Posting List

New open posting in the FEC file

Process Data in DART

Settings for data extraction with Tcode FTWP

Go to FTW1A create the DART extract select FR for the language

You can analyze the extract using the transaction FTWF

Generate FEC File

Start the view 2FR_FI01 with transaction FTWH

 

Go in transaction FTWN you can display and export your generated data

How to test FEC file

The validation program is available on the ministry website

Outil de test des fichiers des écritures comptables (FEC) | Ministère de l’Économie des Finances et de la Souveraineté industrielle et numérique

After installation, run the program. The screen is the same as the one used by the authorities. You should fill the field "Entrer le numéro alpage du dossier" with your number as the file naming example ("111222333"). This is mandatory.

The second field is optional; you can write the name of your company into this.

Also choose the type of your chart of account on the left column (Type de plan comptable) and the type of the revenue category on the right column (Type de revenus). Then you can upload the file to be tested by clicking on the icon "Selectionner un fichier á traiter".

Select the relevant local file. After that your can start the test by clicking on the "Valider" button.

At the end of the test, a summary document is generated in PDF format. It is automatically displayed and saved. The first page of the summary contains general information about this validation process.

The second page shows the mandatory fields required by the law and the fields of the actual FEC file next to it.

Additional notes and comments about the file are displayed on the third page. Generally, these notes have two types: in some cases, these are problems what should be solved in order to get correct file from technical aspect. For example, if there are missing data, it is displayed under the heading „Données absentes”. There are also informational comments, in these cases the file is technically correct. These are displayed under the heading „Observations complémentaires”.

entry.title: Explore SAP Localization With the Global Map of Local Versions
entry.content:
In today’s interconnected world, businesses are growing across borders faster than ever. But with global growth comes local complexity — from tax regulations to payroll rules and legal reporting.

Whether you're a consultant, developer, or business user, navigating country-specific requirements and features can be challenging. SAP simplifies this journey with the global map of local versions. This interactive application is your one-stop destination to explore SAP-provided local versions across the globe.

Ready to explore SAP’s localization capabilities?
Visit sap.com/localization and go global with confidence.

 

What is a local version?

A local version is a set of system functionalities tailored to meet the legal, regulatory, and business requirements of a specific country or region. Think tax reports, payroll rules, or legal reporting formats — all built into SAP solutions to enable compliance and efficiency.

 

Key features of the global map

1. Comprehensive coverage

Explore over 1000 local versions for countries and regions. The global map of local versions simplifies your localization journey by offering a holistic view of SAP’s localization portfolio.

2. Search & filter

Easily find what you need by filtering the interactive map:

  • By Product: Filter by SAP S/4HANA Cloud, SAP SuccessFactors, etc.
  • By Country/Region: Select from a list or use the interactive map.
  • By Deployment Type: Cloud, on-premise
  • By Solution Type: SAP, or Partner solution

The map view provides a visual overview, while the list view offers granular details — ideal for consultants preparing rollout plans or developers assessing localization gaps.

 

3. Stay ahead of regulatory changes

Direct links to SAP’s regulatory change manager help you stay informed about upcoming regulations and how they impact your business. These links are prefiltered for you to continue your localization journey and find prospective regulatory changes.

 

4. Find the right SAP Partner

Need additional localization support? Use the SAP-Qualified Partner-Packaged Solution Finder and search for integrated solutions built, sold, and supported by SAP partners that combine SAP software with industry or line-of-business expertise, services, customizations, or applications.

 

5. Deep dive into SAP business solutions

Want to explore further? Use the direct link to the specific SAP product webpage, access dedicated resources and request a demo to expand your SAP landscape.

 

Realize your global potential with SAP

SAP’s localization capabilities give you the breadth of coverage and depth of expertise to run your business globally — while staying locally compliant.

Visit sap.com/localization and take your business global with confidence.

 

Have you used the global map of local versions for your projects? Share your feedback or tips in the comments below.
